module.name: scevent
module.description: Associates an Origin to an Event or forms a new Event if no match is found. Selects the preferred magnitude.

parameter.name: eventIDPrefix
parameter.description: Prefix for all Event IDs

parameter.name: eventIDPattern
parameter.description:
Defines the pattern to generate an event ID.
%p : prefix
%Y : year
%[w]c: alpha character
%[w]C: upper case alpha character
%[w]d: decimal
%[w]x: hexadecimal
%[w]X: upper case hexadecimal
[w] is an optional width parameter.

parameter.name: rect
parameter.description: Region in which scevent is allowed to create events.

parameter.name: minimum
parameter.description: Minimum depth for which scevent is allowed to create events.

parameter.name: maximum
parameter.description: Maximum depth for which scevent is allowed to create events.

parameter.name: minimumMagnitudes
parameter.description: Minimum number of station magnitudes referenced to a network magnitude to become a preferred magnitude.

parameter.name: minimumMatchingArrivals
parameter.description: Minimum number of matching picks between two origins to be associated to the same event.

parameter.name: maximumMatchingArrivalTimeDiff
parameter.description: If this time window in seconds is negative, pickIDs are compared to find matching arrivals. A non negative value (including 0) compares pick times regardless of the pickID. Pass: |pick1.time - pick2.time| <= threshold

parameter.name: compareAllArrivalTimes
parameter.description: This parameter is only used in conjunction with eventAssociation.maximumMatchingArrivalTimeDiff. If a station has multiple associated arrivals for a particular event, this flag defines if the time distance of a new pick to all arrivals must be within eventAssociation.maximumMatchingArrivalTimeDiff or if one matching arrival is enough.

parameter.name: minimumDefiningPhases
parameter.description: Minimum number of Picks for an Origin that is automatic and cannot be associated with an Event to be allowed to form an new Event.

parameter.name: eventTimeBefore
parameter.description: Time range before the origin time of an incoming origin to search for matching events.

parameter.name: eventTimeAfter
parameter.description: Time range after the origin time of an incoming origin to search for matching events.

parameter.name: maximumTimeSpan
parameter.description: Associates an origin with an existing event if the origin time differs not more than 60 seconds unless the minimumMatchingArrivals criteria matches.

parameter.name: maximumDistance
parameter.description: Allowed location difference between an incoming origin compared with preferred origins to get associated.

parameter.name: minMwCount
parameter.description: Minimum number of station magnitudes required for Mw(mB) to be considered as preferred magnitude.

parameter.name: mbOverMwCount
parameter.description: Minimum number of station magnitudes which ensures that Mw(mB) will be preferred and not mb.

parameter.name: mbOverMwValue
parameter.description: Average between mb and Mw(mB) which must be exceeded to become Mw(mB) preferred.

parameter.name: enableFallbackMagnitude
parameter.description: If true, one magnitude will be preferred even if magnitude criteria are not fullfilled.

parameter.name: magTypes
parameter.default: mBc, Mw(mB), Mwp, ML, MLh, MLv, mb
parameter.description: Magnitude type priority list for becoming a preferred magnitude for an event.

parameter.name: agencies
parameter.description: The agencyID priority list. When the eventtool comes to the point to select a preferred origin it orders all origins by its agency priority and selects then the best one among the highest priority agency. It also defines the agency priority for custom priority checks (eventAssociation.priorities).

parameter.name: authors
parameter.description: The author priority list. When the eventtool comes to the point to select a preferred origin it orders all origins by its author priority and selects then the best one among the highest priority author. It also defines the author priority for custom priority checks (eventAssociation.priorities).

parameter.name: priorities
parameter.description:
The general priority list to decide if an origin becomes preferred. This feature is new not used unless this parameter is activated. This list replicates the old hard wired behaviour: AGENCY, STATUS, PHASES_AUTOMATIC, TIME_AUTOMATIC
Available tokens:
AGENCY: check based on agency priorities
AUTHOR: check based on author priorities
STATUS: manual origins rule out automatic ones
METHOD: check based on the method priorities
PHASES: higher phase count = higher priority
PHASES_AUTOMATIC: only checks phase priorities for incoming automatic origins
RMS: lower rms = higher priority
RMS_AUTMATIC: [**check spelling!**] only check RMS on incoming automatic origins
TIME: more recent origins (creationTime) have higher priorities
TIME_AUTOMATIC: only checks creationTime priority on incoming automatic origins

parameter.name: delayTimeSpan
parameter.description: Configures a timespan in seconds to delay event creation. If a new origin arrives which cannot be associated to an existing event, delay the event creation for a certain timespan.

group.name: delayFilter
group.description: The delayFilter group configures an origin filter to activate the delay feature for this origin. If more than one filter is given they are combined with AND.

parameter.name: agencyID
parameter.description: The agencyID of the origin to be delayed.

parameter.name: author
parameter.description: The author of the origin to be delayed.

parameter.name: evaluationMode
parameter.description: The evaluation mode of the origin to be delayed. Can be either "manual" or "automatic".

option.description: Time span in hours after which objects expire.
OriginID to be associated. When given no messages are sent. Only the status of the association is written to stdout.
